content:
TERM: Causal Inference

DEFINITION:
A cognitive capability, enabled by the CausalInferenceTool, focused on identifying cause-and-effect relationships within data, moving beyond mere correlation. In v3.0+, this includes temporal capabilities to detect and analyze time-delayed effects (CausalLagDetectioN).

BLUEPRINT DETAILS:
See ResonantiA Protocol v3.0, Section 3.12, 7.13.

EXAMPLE APPLICATION:
Using CausalinferencE, the system determined that a marketing campaign had a significant causal impact on sales, but with a 7-day lag.

CATEGORY: AnalyticalTool

RELATIONSHIPS:
type: MechanismIdentification; implemented_by: CausalInferenceTool, perform_causal_inference action; includes_capability: CausalLagDetectioN; informs: Agent based modelinG rules, StrategicIntervention; contributes_to: 4d thinkinG; confidence: high
